moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Bc4 Qh4+ 4. Kf1: I know White wins more from this position but I wanted to try a defense to see what he would do.
moves.4... Nf6 5. Nf3 Qh6 6. Nc3 c6: I debated here. I thought this move might be better than either Bb4 or d5.
moves.7. Ne5 d5 8. exd5 Bd6 9. d4: I missed the impact of this move. It holds the central tension and begins the pressure on the advanced f pawn.
moves.9... O-O 10. Qf3 Nh5: Was not sure what to do here.
moves.11... Ng3+: Hoping the complications might give Black opportunties.
moves.12. Qxg3 fxg3 13. Bxh6 gxh6 14. Nc4 Bf4: Black is trying to preserve equality, but White's edge in development is too hard to meet.
moves.16. Rxh6 Bf5 17. Nd6: A nice move with multiple threats.
moves.17... Bxc2 18. Nxb7 cxd5 19. Rh3: Black loses at least a pawn and still is behind in development. Resignation was in order.

gameName: Freddie's Lesson on the KB Gambit
